http://bergmanbits.com/
and read the blog
http://thepiratebay.org/blog/80

Thanks IggyPop for making this available.  The subs are there.  Get XP to associate the sub file with VLC.  Then select the sub file, then while within VLC open the avi file and the movie will play with the subs.  There may be another way to do this but it worked for me.  I used VLC v0.8.6c.
subs don't play on my DVD player or computer.Could you post the subtitles in .srt format?Please look into it IggyPop.

Some of you people are idiots. the subs are INCLUDED. It's very simple. Ever thought about opening your eyes before asking generous peple to do your work for you? I feel sorry for your parents.

Anyway, thanks iggy, excellent stuff :)
